description: Remote sensing and GIS are increasingly used to address basic and applied questions in
the environmental sciences and a host of other disciplines. Students survey available
remote sensing image types and learn to process (ground-truthing, GPS, scanning,
digitizing) and interpret remotely sensed images. They also learn theory and practice of
geographic information systems (basic cartography and spatial statistics). A weekly
three-hour laboratory is required. Offered annually. Prerequisites: ENVST 137 or a level
I course in biology, chemistry, or physics.
fullname: Remote Sensing and Geographic Information Systems
